page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: The railway line which links{Sheffield and{Manchester}runs along the valley bottom but no longer stops at Oughtibridge.Running parallel with the line is the main road to Manchester from Sheffield.This road carries heavy traffic and is extremely narrow in parts .Road widening is impossible due to the river Don being on the east side and a steep wooded bank on the west .A by pass has been the subject of dispute for a number of years. A bus service runs frequently from Sheffield along the Don valley and up the hillside to the west.
